reviews.text: Beautiful place, very well maintained. Fantastic view over Chiang Rai but not today with all the smoke in the air (2019-03-18).  And two young soldiers that gave us good guidence and information.
Good place for memorie to King Rama IX
น่าจะทำแบบจำลองแล้วนำมาประดิษฐานแทน แทนที่จะพัฒนา และนำของจริงไว้ที่เดิมเพื่อเป็นการกระจายนักท่งเที่ยว ส่วนบรรยากาศถือว่าดี
ศาลาอยู่ในค่ายทหาร สามารถเข้าไปได้เลย.. สร้างไว้ยิ่งใหญ่สมพระเกียรติ บรรยากาศเงียบสงบ

เป็นที่เก็บรักษารอยพระบาท ของพระบาทสมเด็จพระเจ้าอยู่หัวภูมิพลอดุลยเดชมหาราช (รัชกาลที่ 9) เมื่อครั้งเสด็จเยี่ยมราษฎรจังหวัดเชียงราย เพื่อเป็นขวัญและกำลังใจแก่ทหารและประชาชนช่วงที่เผชิญภัยคุกคามจากคอมมิวนิสต์

Hundreds of Lanna and related cultural artifacts on careful display. The owner has done an amazing task in finding and keeping these items in very good shape. Some items are alleged to be over 1000 year old. Ticket include an English speaking tour of the chambers of collections. Well worth the money.

May you not see fancy things here, it is because you are not allowed to taking photos of their precious collections. The owner was collects many items which related to Lanna Kingdom, there are a lot fascinating things inside like buddha statue made of precious stone, royal items in the past, etc. You will have personal guide here who can speak english. After session you can taking photos in one of the room, and staff will give you delicious tea.
Personal collection from descendant of Lanna Kingdom. Worth the visit. Many interesting items that you would not see other places.
Great place understand lana culture
Beautiful place. Worth the 300baht. Came with a very informative personal guide . And even tea at the end. Great for pictures and even greater to learn the history of the Lanna people

Hundreds of Lanna and related cultural artifacts on careful display. The owner has done an amazing task in finding and keeping these items in very good shape. Some items are alleged to be over 1000 year old. Ticket include an English speaking tour of the chambers of collections. Well worth the money.

May you not see fancy things here, it is because you are not allowed to taking photos of their precious collections. The owner was collects many items which related to Lanna Kingdom, there are a lot fascinating things inside like buddha statue made of precious stone, royal items in the past, etc. You will have personal guide here who can speak english. After session you can taking photos in one of the room, and staff will give you delicious tea.
Personal collection from descendant of Lanna Kingdom. Worth the visit. Many interesting items that you would not see other places.
Great place understand lana culture
Beautiful place. Worth the 300baht. Came with a very informative personal guide . And even tea at the end. Great for pictures and even greater to learn the history of the Lanna people

Nice monument to have a look at in the centre of town. The meeting point for the free city tour is just behind it and needs a minimum of 6 people to go ahead. The tour was great and brings you to the major free spots in the city. 10-15 min stops at each one. The tour isn't all in English but it didn't bother us.

I walked past this place on my way to the OK craft beer place.  It's a nice place.  Worth the visit.  As other people have said, early morning or just as the sun is setting is a good time to be here.  Just be careful of the traffic here, it's quite a busy junction

This is a monument for the founder of the city (approx 1200's, 1300's). It's a nice little green area in the city with some hawkers (flowers, lottery tix, etc). There was a guy playing a cool musical instrument. I went at night so maybe in missing out on something, not sure.

kings monument is the most important square in the heart of ChiangvRai city. the kings statue is worshipped by the thai people like god. the square is well maintained and the junction is always busy. the spot could have been ideal to watch the sun rise but the view towards east is spoilt by two giant bill boards. the topiaries at the monument are beautifully designed. the garden is well maintained. you can shop for souvenirs here. also there are seven eleven shops on the both sides. in the evening you can enjoy street food around the monument.
Very beautiful well maintained spiritual site , parking limited, a must see

The tour to Laos- after the boarder crossing before getting on the boat, you'll get on the back of a truck. The trucks will then stop right before you go to Pier. The man will say this is your last stop before you board, we will sell you rooms for a cheap price and if I am lying to you, I will give you a full refund. He also said, I've already talked to the boat and they are not serving any food or drinks. IT IS A COMPLETE SCAM. The over charged EVERYONE. 500Baht a room, 50baht water and what ever food and beers they sell. When you get to the pier, they sell food at a shop or you can buy food on the boat. They have hot water on the boat as well. 
We didn't go on the fancy slow-boat, we did the 1600baht tour. The people at the dock too will sell you a room for 400baht. Once you arrive at Pak Phang they will sell you a room for 200baht. They will announce prices in USD (the scammer from part 1 of the story). Don't give them USD. The stores will also try and not give you the correct KIP back. They will scam you too. Count your KIP. We almost got  ripped off twice. 
Once you arrive at the final destination, they will make you pay for a shuttle or a tuktuk 20000 KIP. It's a rip off because if you walk .5km down the road to the main road, you can get one for 10000KIP.
It's nothing but a battle of scams.
The tour to the Laos is a good idea because of all the steps involved but it's a shame that everyone is out for your dollars.
Very good service. 👀

Gute individuelle Beratung und Angebot. Wir hatten eine  Privat Tour genau mit unseren Wunschzielen. Kleinere Änderungen waren auch kein Problem. Einziger kleiner Schwachpunkt wae, dass der Fahrer kein Englisch konnte jedoch war ee dennoch sehr zuverlässig.

トレッキングツアーへ1日、ゴールデントライアングルとメーサロン行きの車チャーターをお願いしました。
到着してから電話させてもらったのですが、やりたいことへの的確なアドバイスとアレンジがズバっと早く、その後のやり取りもわかりやすくて安心して予約できます、お勧め!
現地でのガイドさんとドライバーさんもとても丁寧。運転もゆっくり安全でした。
自然の中へ行く機会が多いチェンライのツアーは、現場は英語ガイドですが日本人スタッフとのホットラインがあると安心度が全然違うと思います。
Beautiful building.  Beautiful people!
Very quiet place
How beautiful

Protestant type church.  Well attended.  Friendly.  No icons or statues, just a large cross over the altarspace.  Went to the Christmas Eve service.  Lively and competent praise and worship band.  Christmas Carol lyrics projected on the walls in Thai.  Fun nativity play.  Good service.  Large choir.  A good Christian experience.  Praise the lord!
The first one
Excellent an authentic temple the shine marks the real city centre and is close to the large and very interesting market. Well worth seeing

An amazing place .. so high in the mountain 
The sculptures are extremely detailed and the painting are indescribable 

The teleferico to access is is quite slow though
I think worth a look. Architecture was quite magnificent. We used hotel bicycles and rode the 12 hm to visit. Think it was worth it and we needed excercise
Great little temple. They don't let women in the ubosot. Minus one star!

The Wat Klang Wiang is one of the most ornate temples in Chiang Rai. Every structure in the temple complex is richly decorated. The temple hall is built in a contemporary Lanna style guarded by nagas.

The green jade buddha (although only a copy)  great artistic interior. Turtles looked happy.  Usual array of Thai decorations abound.  Shoes off before climbing stairs to temple proper. Great collection of flowering orchids.  No fee!

A small temple located within the city centre of Chiang Rai, which has a long history dating back to 14 Century. Once a resting place for The Emerald Buddha before moving to its current location of The Royal Temple in Bangkok. This temple is a well-known place not just for the locals but also out-of-towners. Visitors can learn about its history through painting surround the replica of The Emerald Buddha. Although the parking space is limited but visitors can temporary park on the side street without worries. Visitors can visits this temple using city tram which would stop to tourist attraction around the city.

I'm very impressed with this temple. It's very very well maintained with a very beautiful and peaceful temple grounds with very lovely huge orchids. The detailed and beautifully crafted Buddha is breathtaking. The temple staff was very welcoming. A monk was even explaining the different symbolism of Buddhism. The temple has a very good museum with explanation in English. It's a very educational place of worship. I wish I had more time. I would love to listen to the monk explain the religious significance of the various objects as he spoke very good English.

Peaceful ancient old temple. The build date was unkown today, many record was lost during ancient war. n the temple is statue of Jade Buddha that survive through tough miracle journey and, Thai-Burma war. In the eye of most it may seem to be fairy tale story. However in the Buddhist world is a impossible miracle.🙄🤔🤔😎😎

Leave your shoes outside please 😁. I don't think I've ever been in a more tranquil place in my life. I went early in the morning and the place was not crowded. We enjoyed many temples here which includes a replica of the Emerald Budha which the original was sent by river to Bankok and housed at the royal palace. The museum has beautiful Siam relics. I truly enjoyed the culture and the history. This place is FREE! and you can leave donations outside if you want with the people who take care of the grounds. Thai people have beautiful spirits. Everyone was so nice to us and even allowed me to charge my phone from all the pictures I was taking. That definitely deserved a tip and recognition.

Chiang Rai by far was one of those towns that you feel safe. We walked around town like we owned the spot 😂. No need for taxi or a guide.
Awesome small temple packed with history. King Mengrai came here and also there is a city pillar and some great views.

One of Chiang rai's temples. It is located kind of further from the city center and at the top of a hill, so it may take you a while if you walk up there. The place was quite, but unfortunately we did not enjoy much of the view because of the weather.
There is a beautiful view out over surrounding woods and hills at the rear of the main prayer hall (pictured).

the significant ancient monastery with historical relevant stories about Chiang Rai town establishment legend since the previous day. 

nice to see the brand new chapel building, however from my personal, the previous old Lanna traditional structure style would be more attractive and charming.

the stunning elaborately fine art work of the wooden chapel door was so beautiful.

worth for visiting place, even thought the building structure was a bit new.

Not over run with tourists makes for a welvomed change from other "famous" Wat. It has a more authentic feeling due to the daily village life going on in and around the temple. Plenty of  good food to be had from nearby street vendors to fairly upscale restaurants in the very near vicinitu.
Central Plaza Chiang Rai is the best shopping mall in the city and the entire province. The food court on the lowest floor also has very good Northern Thai food.

I came here looking for the AIS telephone shop. Found it very quickly the people were super nice and got my business done in a timely fashion. It's a very comfortable Mall only two floors so it's not packed with stuff.

It's a mall, which you could expect to find everything; food, cloth, grocery, gadget, cinema etc. Ranging from the cheap to the affordable brand name ones, Central Plaza Chiang Rai is the solution for whom looking for the all-in-one shopping place. There are also various kinds of taxi service. But beware! the price can be bargain.

Great little mall with movie theater. They offer a free shuttle to and from town as it is a 15 drive out of the city core. If you decide to drive parking is free but can be a bit of an issue. It is often full.

Biggest mall in Chiang Rai.  Similar to most Central Plazas around the country, but perhaps smaller. Great place to shop and find big city items. Top store had a great choice of imported foods, better than in most cites in Thailand. As with any Thai mall, parking is a challenge on weekends.
Really chilling and relaxing place! Fantastic thaifood with reasonable prices! I can fully recommend to go there with some friends!

This is sort of a park where a local youth relaxes in the end of the day. 
A bit too dirty, a bit to dark, but probably it's very pleasant to be at water when a hot day
Nice hang during day not night
Murky water, good view of buddha statue across the banks
Park around the river is quite dirty. So much interesting you can not find there but thai people are going there for picknik.

The service was excellent and very quick. Perhaps too quick! For such a well known place it was very cheap. Parking is tricky but a Nong boy will help as it gets busier.
The food itself is probably better than expected to be honest. Some dishes were better than others. Either exceptional or good, but never less than that.
Nice river views, we got there early on a Friday evening - about half 4. There were about 4 river side tables left, and that many again reserved. But the reserved tables seem to be for about 6 people at least. I'm not sure if they'll reserve a table for two. By the time we left, decent tables were scant.

Ordered four dishes for sharing and all were hits. Very relaxed place, and most enjoyable evening. Ate dinner overlooking the river. We have every intention of hitting again during our very brief stay in Chiang Rai.
A popular local destination by the river. Food was decent, good atmosphere along with good service. There is a big photo wall of fame where a lot of celebrities came to eat.

Great restaurant, amazing food. Get early because gets crowded. Also a lot of the dishes are veryyyyy spicy. Get a table by the water. If you want to see more amazing reviews, tips and pics from our trip around the world for a year follow @AlbertoLamaPhotographer & @TravelingLamas
Great view. Average food quality. Waitresses are poorly trained for their jobs. Price is high for food quality. You are paying for the view which is very nice.

I went here this morning to catch a bus to the white temple. 50 baht for roast duck with rice, comes with sauces and a couple slices of cucumber. I asked for take away and they put it in a polystyrene box, well packed and no extra cost. Recommended
Great food. The duck with rice and pork soup were excellent. Around 40 bht upwards a dish.
Very accommodating service. Simple and comfortable
The stew pork knuckle one of the best in Thailand
Very nice noodle n excellent value. Very busy

Do not miss it. No doubt the coolest place in town. Not only a unique culinary experience (with no fuss and totally unpretentious food made of fresh ingredients) with fusion Northern Thai/European mouthwatering dishes, but the building is also phenomenal. Totally unique, built in teak and beautifully decorated. The atmosphere is sereine and peaceful, the garden beautifully wild and the staff is so kind and helpful they put to shame a luxury 5* hotel.

We stopped here after a long day at the white temple. The interior is phenomenal. The attention to detail is incredible. Everything is neat and tidy. The staff is very welcoming and attentive.

We had a cappuccino and pizza. The pizza was delicious! This is definitely a handy guide class place. Perfect for business meal. I uploaded some photos to give you an idea of what to expect.

We went for our complimentary breakfast for our stay at Ngeeb bed and breakfast.  The interior design was very thoughtful, service was great, food was good.  Recommend getting a local espresso.  Had american breakfast and Thai breakfast.

This would be five stars if they had not been drilling and sawing while I was trying to enjoy my meal. The food was great and staff where nice. I want to be able to hear myself think when enjoying a coffee.
Awesome breakfast, coffee and northern Thai style food - you can easily ask questions or make reservations via facebook and the hours are great!!!

Was very disappointed with the fish and chips that cost 350THB. It arrived with batter golden brown but when I cut into it, I could see the fish not fully cooked. Inform the staff and she changed it for me. Alas when it came, I had the same issue but this time it was worst. You could see that it was not defrosted properly and water was literally under the batter. Should have ate at the hotel instead. Yes I was charged fully for it too. Definitely not recommending this restaurant!!! For the kind of prices they charge you can get better food elsewhere.
I don't recommend this place. Can eat In a 5 star  restaurant for the prices they have. Better options else where.👎

Overpriced restaurant that targets Western tourists. I came only because I was hangry but actually pleasantly surprised by the curry. Not the best curry I've had by a long shot, but not bad. And there are tons of backhome favorites available for Europeans....if that's what you are looking for
We had a very nice dinner here. My son loved the hamburger and I enjoyed the Thai food very much.

Serve good food. Cater for tourist that demand better then average.
It is much more expensive then average restaurant. Local and  expat properly avoid this place. Been here a few time during early 90's. Steak is good and a bit expensive though good quality.
Nice view of mountain range.

Great place for stopby on the highway Chaingmai -Chaingrai. 
This Doi-Chang hill got there own endemic coffee ( Region coffee). So try doi-chang coffe once if you have a chance.
วิวดีมากๆ สำหรับผู้ที่มากางเต้นได้โปรดรักษาความสะอาดหน่อยขยะเย่อะเพราะพวกกางเต้น เรามาก่งทีหลังต้องช่วยกันเก็บทิ้งอีก ไม่ใช่หน้าที่เลย พวกมักง่ายเย่อะมากในประเทศไทย
กาแฟรสชาตดี ดอยสูง อากาสดี

ดอยช้างบรรยากาศดีมากเป็นสถานที่นักท่องเที่ยวนิยมมาเที่ยวและลิ้มรสกาแฟที่มีชื่อเสียงยี่ห้อหนึ่งที่โด่งดังในบ้านเรา ที่นี่สูงจากระดับน้ำทะเลถึง1,700เมตร ที่นี่มีปลูกไร่กาแฟพันธุ์อาราบิก้า เป็นกาแฟคุณภาพ กลิ่มหอม รสชาติดีทีเดียว บนดอยช้างก็มีชนเผ่าพื้นเมืองพักอาศัยอยู่ ที่ได้เห็นก็มีชนเผ่าลีซอ ชนเผ่าอาข่า น่าจะพักอาศัยกันมานานแล้วบนดอยช้างแห่งนี้ ใครมาที่นี่ต้องจิบกาแฟ จิบชาในตอนเช้า ชมบรรยากาศทุ่งหญ้าสีเขียว ต้นไม้นานาชนิด และหมอกขาวโพลน ได้อรรถรสมาก

They doing baby ear piercing here. The staff that work at the jewellery store are really friendly. They ways gave two staff to pierce baby ears as they do both at the same time to prevent added stress to the child which is perfect

Ignite Records is the best record store in the city. A real vinyl cavern that is packed with fairly priced records to suit a wide range of tastes. Rich (the owner) is a real gent, very knowledgeable and accommodating. The store is friendly and welcoming. Important we keep this indie going!
Legendary Birmingham fixture! Great place to get alternative/rock clothing and accessories  in an iconic location in the centre of town for nearly 50 years.

I have been going to Oasis for over 10 years now and every time you go in it is exciting, literally like a kid in a sweet shop. There is always something new and exciting going on. Highly recommend it!

Oasis has lost it appeal and is no longer a fashion markets. It's now full of rude and over priced tattoo parlours and pretentious "clothing shops". Not to mention the shops selling drug paraphernalia. 

Both inside and out the markets are rundown and are stuck in the 1980s and is in need of updating and bring in to this millennium. 
The markets also attracts the wrong kind of people and is a center of anti-social behaviour. I have often seen the police and security patrolling and moving people on. 

The Oasis markets are full of empty stalls and shops, which adds to the rundown feeling.

In conclusion, I would not recommend visting the markets for this reason.

If you visit Chiang Rai you simply must go here for dinner. Food and Service impeccable. Genuine hospitality. Very friendly. Incredible quality and value. Very good English spoken. Great menu. Very good for Vegetarian and Vegan customers.

Easily one of the best meals we had in all of Thailand. Great food and portions in a beautiful guesthouse garden, with truly affordable prices and value for money. Their service is impeccable, the staff are friendly and approachable, and the showcase of northern Thai cuisine is hugely remarkable. Fantastic experience and dined their twice (very rare for us to do whilst traveling). HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

On a 2 month vacation this was hands down the best meal we have had in Thailand. Our server was amazing! Didnt get her name though. She explained all the dishes to us, which was really awesome. I loved the food and the service. She truly made our day and experience. Thank you guys very much, fantastic meal.

I ordered the Basil fried rice with tofu and it was excellent. One of the best fried rice meals I've had so far. The service was awesome and communication was easy as the boss lady and our waitress both spoke english pretty well. I highly recommend!
Great atmosphere, service, and delicious food. Good portion size for reasonable price. I can't wait to go back to Chiang Mai for Khao Soy at Barrab!

This is a nice casual restaurant with a good cause theme to promote family planning and HIV awareness with proceeds going to fund this. Food is reasonably priced for a restaurant in Bangkok with most mains being around 200 baht. Service is very good and the food tasted great. You can sit inside or outside in a lovely courtyard area lit with lanterns and fairy lights. There is also traditional live thai music playing in the background which i thought was recorded until i looked around and saw the lady playing. Well worth going for a meal and supporting a good cause.

What makes the place unique is that it is a restaurant with a cause. It seems funny that they give away condoms but it is because they want to promote safe sex. Food is good. Less one star because they don't give service water.

This little quirky place is amazing. The food and service was great and their work is great too. They help with sexual education and other causes which is amazing. Highly recommended going. They have a decent sized gift shop too.

Nice concept of this restaurant, i can said it is unique. Really famous for tourist and foreigner. It serve the Thai Traditional Food. The environment is cozy. And as the name, condom will give after end of eating.

Funny little theme restaurant that does great work for sex ed and other charitable causes.  The food was really delicious, and they have a little shop with souvenirs as well if you'd like some amusing condom-themed stuff or even other things (spices, cookbooks, pashminas).  There's information there about other business they run and the work the profits support.  I definitely recommend going!

Graeat luscious garden with many, many bungalows. Very good breakfast-  western and asian. Good coffee, smoking is otside but there are also good seatings. Motorbike and car rent from the resort. Beautiful and clean pool. Room service- 8 of 10 but decent. Room service with food ordering. Good food. Tasted only local though. Public toilets- 7 of 10. Nice and quiet resort to stay in this busy town. 7 eleven is just few hundred meters around the corner if needed.

Gardens were absolutely lovely, rooms great and beds nice. Pool was good. Only issue was the noise from neighbouring rooms... could hear everything in adjoining rooms. They were doing some rennovation so hopefully an issue being addressed.

Room was great, renovated recently and had one of those rainfall showers. Very clean. I ordered a Thai foot massage and a glass of wine at the end of the night, it was EVERYTHING! Hotel staff is very friendly, service is superb - I will definitely be coming back next time I’m in Chiang Rai.

The pool villas have paper wall's and can hear every single word from the room next door. The room maids start working at 7am and talking and laughing super loud that sleeping impossible. The massage chair in the lobby offer the service for 10THB but only eat money and not work and if ask the concierge on the counter he answer: not my business???
And even know it's broken still let it run to cheat next guest???
All in one it's for the price the most worth Hotel I ever was here in Chiang Rai.
Will sure never meet again!!!!
Lacking atmosphere despite lovely gardens.  Feels a bit like a retirement village; staff lacking in customer service skills.
